intro: Iris hungarica var. subtriflora, commonly known as the Hungarian iris, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Europe. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial to full shade. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. The variety subtriflora is distinguished by its smaller, more compact growth habit compared to other iris species.
